benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/credits - Create a credit

covered: POST Method - Valid Payload Scenarios: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC07 (single/multiple credits, with/without invoiceId, autoCommit, CBA behavior).

POST Method - Validation and Invalid Payload Coverage: TC11 (malformed JSON), TC12 (missing required fields), TC14 (invalid accountId), TC15 (unsupported currency), TC16 (invalid pluginProperty), TC10 (missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header), TC13 (positive amount handling).
Authorization / Access Control Coverage: TC18 (403 insufficient permissions) and TC10 (400 for missing required header).
Server/Error Handling and Integrations: TC17 (service unavailable), TC28 (plugin system unavailable), TC29 (plugin error).
Edge Cases Coverage: TC21 (empty body), TC22 (extra fields ignored), TC23 (maximum allowed credits in a single request), TC24 (very large payload), TC25 (timeout).
Idempotency and Regression Coverage: TC30 (idempotent retries), TC31 (backward compatibility without pluginProperty/autoCommit).
State Management Coverage: TC26 (only account exists) and TC27 (existing credits/invoices).
Security Coverage: TC19 (SQL injection attempts) and TC20 (XSS attempts in headers).
Performance Coverage: TC32 (normal load response time), TC33 (peak load concurrency), TC34 (system resource utilization).
Integration/Test Coverage: TC05 (pluginProperty passed to plugin), TC28/TC29 (plugin system integration scenarios).
gaps: Rate Limiting and throttling tests (no explicit scenario for repeated bursts).
Caching headers validation (ETag/Cache-Control) not covered for POST responses.
401 Unauthorized scenario explicitly (authentication failure) is not separately tested (only 400 for missing header).
Pagination considerations are not applicable to POST create operations but not explicitly documented for POST in guidelines; no dedicated pagination tests exist.
recommendations: Add an explicit 401 Unauthorized test case to complement the 403 scenario (distinguish auth failures).
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to validate behavior under bursts (e.g., 429 responses).
Add validations for caching headers on POST responses (ETag/Cache-Control) where applicable, or explicitly document if not used.
Consider a targeted test for idempotency edge cases beyond TC30 (e.g., retries with partial failures).
Maintain and expand accessibility coverage beyond documentation discovery (e.g., ensuring screen-reader friendly error messages in responses).
